articles.title: Argentina Will Buy Chinese Imports in Yuan to Preserve Dollar Reserves
articles.description: Argentina wants to spend fewer dollars after a crippling drought slashed its agricultural exports, which cut the amount of greenbacks coming in.
articles.content:
Argentina will start paying for Chinese imports in yuan instead of dollars, Reuters reported.
The country wants to preserve its dwindling greenback reserves.
A historic drought has hit Argentina's agricultural exports, meaning fewer dollars are comin... [2025 chars]

articles.title: Argentina to Pay for Chinese Imports in Yuan Instead of Dollars
articles.description: Argentina will pay for Chinese imports in yuan instead of US dollars to preserve its foreign reserves. Economy Minister Sergio Massa announced that the country will program a volume of imports worth over $1 billion in yuan from next month, replacing the use of Argentina's US dollar reserves.
articles.content:
Argentina will pay for Chinese imports in yuan instead of US dollars in order to preserve its dwindling foreign reserves, Economy Minister Sergio Massa said on Wednesday.
The South American country will be able to “program a volume of imports in yuan... [1348 chars]

articles.title: Argentina to pay for Chinese imports in yuan rather than dollars
articles.description: Argentina will start to pay for Chinese imports in yuan rather than dollars, the government announced Wednesday, a measure that aims to relieve the country's dwindling dollar reserves.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, April 26 (Reuters) - Argentina will start to pay for Chinese imports in yuan rather than dollars, the government announced Wednesday, a measure that aims to relieve the country's dwindling dollar reserves.

articles.title: Argentina: A desperate search for a door as currency tumbles
articles.description: Antonela Massarelli desperately needed a front door for a new house she and her family will be moving into this weekend in a Buenos Aires suburb.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES – Antonela Massarelli desperately needed a front door for the new house she and her family will move into this weekend in a Buenos Aires suburb.

articles.title: I said to him, ‘Basically I hated you as a kid’: Paulo Dybala on the Cristiano Ronaldo-Lionel Messi rivalry
articles.description: Last year, Dybala was part of the Argentina squad led by Lionel Messi that beat France on penalties in the World Cup final to complete the 36-year-old drought since Diego Maradona and Co lifted the 1986 World Cup.
articles.content:
Paulo Dybala terms his time playing with Cristiano Ronaldo at Juventus as ‘three good years’. “We had some laughs. We have always had a good relationship,” the Argentine told DAZN recently.

articles.description: Latest Aston Villa news from BirminghamLive as Emi Martinez discusses his love for the club with Arsenal legend Ian Wright
